Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2009 06:17PM LILLY1955 wrote: So sorry to hear of your less than welcome news.  I took a ton of Xanax after my dx and still take it at night to help me sleep also my surgeon put me on Zoloft for depression and it has truely helped.  I too am emetophobic.  If I throw up my jaw dislocates and I can't breath so when I found out that I had to have chemo I was terrified.  My onco promised me that I wouldn't be sick and he was true to his word..I was never even a little nauseated.  The first day of chemo the nurses asked me if I got sick when I was pregnant---no, asked if I got car sick--no, asked if I was ever sick when I woke up after surgery--no.  They said "you won't be sick at all from chemo" and they were absolutely right.  I took Emend as a pre med plus all the stuff they put in your IV just prior to infusion.  Even went to Starbucks for a Mocha after infusions.  There are so many different meds that they can give you for n/v if you don't respond to one then there is another to try.  ((((hugs))))
Posts.Title: Horrible News re Swollen Groin Node mshalto mshalto

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2009 12:30PM LILLY1955 wrote: Happy Birthday !!  BTW I think I found the 60 lbs you lost.  I'd be more than happy to return it :0
